item.title: 习近平打响价格战，中国严查100美元承销费
item.description: 在国家主席习近平遏制恶性竞争的大背景下，监管机构加大了对长期以来价格战的打击力度，中国正就债券承销费低于100美元的问题对国内一些顶级投资银行进行调查。【原文：China is investigating some of the nation’s top investment banks over bond underwriting fees that hit below $100, as regulators expanded a crackdown on a long-standing price war amid broader efforts by President Xi Jinping to curb cutthroat competition.】

item.title: 投资者权衡特朗普-鲍威尔事件前景，黄金走势平稳
item.description: 周三，在有关美国总统唐纳德-特朗普（Donald Trump）可能会解雇杰罗姆-鲍威尔（Jerome Powell）的更多猜测之后，交易商对鲍威尔担任美联储主席的前景进行了评估。【原文：Gold steadied after a volatile session on Wednesday as traders assessed the outlook for Jerome Powell’s tenure as Federal Reserve chair after more speculation that President Donald Trump may ax him.】

item.title: 私募股权投资老将邵克为回避中国投资
item.description: ShawKwei & Partners 是香港历史最悠久的私募股权投资公司之一，三年前曾转投竞争对手新加坡。【原文：ShawKwei & Partners, one of Hong Kong oldest private equity firms that three years ago decamped for rival Singapore, is staying away from China despite a more bullish sentiment growing toward the world’s second largest economy.】

item.title: 美国关税令通胀降温，亚洲新兴债券吸引力增强
item.description: 由于美国关税促使制造商寻找离本土更近的客户，对亚洲新兴国家地方债券的需求可能会随着地区通胀前景的改善而提高。【原文：Demand for emerging Asia’s local bonds may improve along with the regional inflation outlook, as US tariffs prompt manufacturers to look for customers closer to home.】

item.title: 美国关税引发衰退风险，日本出口下降
item.description: 由于美国的关税行动继续对贸易造成压力，日本的出口连续第二个月下降，这进一步增加了日本经济在年初收缩后出现技术性衰退的风险。【原文：Japan’s exports fell for a second month as the US tariff campaign continued to weigh on trade, further raising the risk of a technical recession after the economy contracted at the start of the year.】

item.title: <strong>估值超过 1000 亿美元的 Anthropic 吸引了投资者的兴趣</strong
item.description: 据一位熟悉内情的人士透露，OpenAI 的竞争对手 Anthropic 正处于计划另一轮投资的早期阶段，该轮投资可能使该公司的估值超过 1000 亿美元。【原文：OpenAI rival Anthropic is in the early stages of planning another investment round that could value the company at more than $100 billion, according to a person familiar with the matter.】

item.title: 石油走高，库存和贸易战成为焦点
item.description: 由于交易商追踪美国库存和华盛顿主导的贸易战的最新变化，石油在连续三天下跌后走高。【原文：Oil edged higher after a three-day drop as traders tracked US stockpiles and the latest twists in the Washington-led trade wars.】

item.title: 债务风险上升，交易员热议日本评级下调威胁
item.description: 日本日益沉重的债务负担和一场有可能使其雪上加霜的选举，正在引发关于日本主权信用评级是否会被提前下调的争论。【原文：Japan’s mounting debt burden and an election that risks making it worse are fueling debate on whether the nation’s sovereign credit rating may be cut sooner rather than later.】

item.title: Coinbase 重新命名加密货币钱包应用，同时包装功能
item.description: 美国最大的数字资产平台 Coinbase Global Inc. 正在对其主要应用程序之一进行品牌重塑，力求为客户整合社交、聊天、支付和交易功能。【原文：Coinbase Global Inc. is rebranding one of its primary apps as the largest US digital asset platform seeks to consolidate social, chat, payment and trading functions in one place for customers.】

item.title: 美元走软，股市因特朗普-鲍威尔事件而攀升：市场综述
item.description: 美国总统唐纳德-特朗普淡化了他可能很快解雇杰罗姆-鲍威尔（Jerome Powell）的前景，美元走软，美国股市在震荡交投中上涨，亚洲股市期货周四在努力寻找方向。【原文：Asian equity futures struggled for direction Thursday after the dollar weakened and US stocks rose in volatile trading after President Donald Trump played down the prospect he may soon fire Jerome Powell.】

item.title: Couche-Tard 放弃斥资 460 亿美元收购 7-Eleven 所有者的计划
item.description: 加拿大 Alimentation Couche-Tard 公司放弃了 6.77 万亿日元（合 458 亿美元）收购 Seven & i Holdings Co.【原文：Canada’s Alimentation Couche-Tard Inc. has abandoned its ¥6.77 trillion ($45.8 billion) bid to buy Seven & i Holdings Co., saying the Japanese operator of 7-Eleven convenience stores had refused to engage meaningfully during the almost yearlong pursuit.】

item.title: 日本 6.8 万亿美元股票市场面临大选倒计时
item.description: 本周日日本上议院投票结束后，如果选举前的民意调查结果属实，那么日本股市将面临长期下跌的风险。【原文：Japanese stocks are at risk of a prolonged decline after the upper house vote this Sunday, if pre-election polls are anything to go by.】

item.title: 威廉姆斯称美联储的限制性立场完全恰当
item.description: 纽约联邦储备银行行长约翰-威廉姆斯（John Williams）表示，他预计未来几个月关税将对通胀产生更大影响，这使得美国央行目前的限制性立场 "完全合适"。【原文：Federal Reserve Bank of New York President John Williams said he expects tariffs to have a bigger impact on inflation in the months ahead, making the US central bank’s current restrictive stance “entirely appropriate.”】

item.title: 隐私丑闻的 Meta 庭审开始，科技、政界大腕云集
item.description: 周三，在特拉华州一家法院对投资者声称该和解协议使其损失至少 70 亿美元的案件进行审理期间，Facebook 与美国隐私监管机构于 2019 年达成的协议的幕后细节浮出水面。【原文：Behind-the-scenes details of an agreement between Facebook and US privacy regulators in 2019 emerged in a Delaware court Wednesday, during a trial on investor claims the settlement cost them at least $7 billion.】

item.title: 巴西国家石油公司希望重返燃油零售业以限制油泵价格
item.description: 在路易斯-伊纳西奥-卢拉-达席尔瓦总统和国家控制的石油公司高层抱怨油价过高之后，巴西国家石油公司正在考虑恢复燃油零售。【原文：Petrobras is considering a return to retail fuel sales after President Luiz Inacio Lula da Silva and the state-controlled oil company’s top executive complained about high pump prices.】

item.title: 特朗普的金融改革：需要纠正还是定时炸弹？
item.description:
在特朗普经济学中，我们讨论了政府竞相放松监管（尤其是对加密货币的监管）是否正在为另一场金融危机埋下伏笔。【原文：

On Trumponomics, we discuss whether the administration’s race to loosen regulations, particularly on crypto, is setting the stage for another financial crisis. 

】

item.title: 美国铝业公司称特朗普关税使铝成本增加 1.15 亿美元
item.description: 美国最大的铝生产商美国铝业公司（Alcoa Corp.【原文：Alcoa Corp., the largest US aluminum producer, said tariffs on imports from Canada cost it $115 million in the second quarter, showing how US President Donald Trump’s trade agenda has affected the industry.】

item.title: 潜龙谍影 2》领导者称卡夫通公司因赔款问题破坏游戏
item.description:
在一份最新公布的申诉书中，被赶下台的领导层指控这家韩国视频游戏发行商无故解雇他们，以夺取对公司的控制权

。【原文：

In a newly unsealed complaint, the ousted leadership group accused the South Korean video-game publisher of firing them without cause to seize control of the company

】

item.title: 美联储主席博斯蒂克在通胀警告下表示将暂缓加息
item.description: 亚特兰大联邦储备银行行长拉斐尔-博斯蒂克（Raphael Bostic）表示，他仍然支持保持利率稳定，并指出最近的通胀数据显示物价压力正在上升。【原文：Federal Reserve Bank of Atlanta President Raphael Bostic said he still supports holding interest rates steady and pointed to recent inflation data showing price pressures are rising.】

item.title: 摩根士丹利以 2021 年以来最丰厚的股票承销额击败竞争对手
item.description: 贸易战的最新消息在第二季度初阻碍了一些资本募集活动，但摩根士丹利在 6 月份卷土重来，创下了自 2021 年第四季度以来全球股票承销费的最好成绩。【原文：Whiplashing trade war updates held up some capital raising at the beginning of the second quarter, but a June comeback led to Morgan Stanley’s best global equity underwriting fee haul since the fourth quarter of 2021.】

item.title: 小唐纳德-特朗普持有的 GrabAGun 公司股份下跌 25% 后仍价值 400 万美元
item.description: 小唐纳德-特朗普（Donald Trump Jr.）周三在距离特朗普组织华尔街 40 号大楼几步之遥的地方，庆祝一家枪支零售商的开业，这家零售商的开业使他的财富增加了 400 万美元。【原文：Steps away from the Trump Organization’s 40 Wall Street building, Donald Trump Jr. on Wednesday heralded the debut of a gun retailer that made him $4 million richer.】

item.title: 日本芯片制造商 Kioxia 首次交易出售 22 亿美元债券
item.description: 芯片制造商 Kioxia Holdings Corp. 在其首次公司债券发行中出售了 22 亿美元的美国垃圾债券，成为最新一家进军海外信贷市场的日本公司。【原文：Chipmaker Kioxia Holdings Corp. sold $2.2 billion of US junk bonds in its first corporate debt issuance, becoming the latest Japanese firm to storm overseas credit markets.】

item.title: 特朗普试图解雇鲍威尔的 "可信威胁 "引发市场震荡
item.description: 唐纳德-特朗普总统再次展示了他撼动全球金融市场的力量。这一次，他回到了自己最喜欢的话题之一：是否解雇美联储主席杰罗姆-鲍威尔。【原文：Once again, President Donald Trump demonstrated his power to shake up global financial markets. This time, by returning to one of his favorite topics: whether to fire Federal Reserve Chair Jerome Powell.】

item.title: 在政府支持下，蒙特利尔机场计划耗资 73 亿美元进行改造
item.description: 蒙特利尔-皮埃尔-埃利奥特-特鲁多国际机场将在未来十年斥资 100 亿加元（约合 73 亿美元）对其设施进行现代化改造和扩建。【原文：Montreal-Pierre Elliott Trudeau International Airport will spend as much as C$10 billion ($7.3 billion) over the next decade to modernize and expand its facilities.】

item.title: 美联储《米色报告》显示美国经济活动略有增长
item.description: 美联储在其《米色手册》（Beige Book）地区商业联系人调查报告中称，美国经济活动在 5 月底至 7 月初期间 "略有增长"。【原文：US economic activity “increased slightly” between late May and early July, the Federal Reserve said in its Beige Book survey of regional business contacts.】

item.title: 亚马逊数据中心建设导致 2024 年排放量攀升 6
item.description: 2024 年，亚马逊公司的碳排放量出现了三年来的首次增长，主要原因是数据中心的建设和其快递供应商的燃料消耗。【原文：Amazon.com Inc.’s carbon emissions rose for the first time in three years in 2024, driven by data center construction and fuel consumption by its delivery providers.】

item.title: Cerba 医疗保健银行在与债权人谈判前进行债务交易
item.description: 出售 Cerba Healthcare SACA 银行贷款的一部分，标志着贷款人正在寻求在债务谈判开始前减少对这家法国实验室企业的风险敞口。【原文：The sale of a piece of a Cerba Healthcare SACA bank loan signals lenders are seeking to trim their exposure to the French laboratories business before the start of debt talks.】

item.title: 西班牙大停电调查显示欧盟电网需要更强的抗灾能力
item.description: 根据欧洲电力传输系统运营商网络的一份报告，对今年早些时候西班牙大范围停电事件的初步调查结果显示，欧洲电网需要提高抗灾能力。【原文：Preliminary findings of an investigation into a wide-ranging blackout in Spain earlier this year show that European power grids need to improve resilience, according to a report from the European Network of Transmission System Operators for Electricity.】

item.title: 斯托尔滕贝格称挪威和美国在关税谈判中 "气氛融洽
item.description: 挪威财政部长表示，挪威正在解决与美国贸易谈判中的 "一些实际问题"，其目标仍然是防止提高关税。【原文：Norway is addressing “some real issues” in its trade talks with the US and still aims to prevent increases in tariffs, according to the country’s finance minister.】

item.title: 哈根达斯生产商为向业主支付 44 亿欧元债务定价
item.description: 哈根达斯冰淇淋生产商 Froneri International Ltd. 正在完成债务交易承诺，以帮助为有史以来最大的一次股东派息提供资金，因为其私募股权共同所有者希望更长久地持有公司股份。【原文：Froneri International Ltd., the maker of Häagen-Dazs ice cream, is wrapping up commitments for a debt deal to help fund one of the largest shareholder payouts on record, as its private equity co-owner looks to keep its stake in the company for longer.】
